description: {"blocks":[{"key":"aslj7","text":"We here provide an implementation of the ssDNA2.0 single-stranded library preparation method (Gansauge et al. 2017, Gansauge et al. 2020) for automated liquid handling on the Bravo NGS workstation B in 96-well format. The method was developed primarily for ancient DNA research but is also suitable for library preparation from other sources of degraded or single-stranded DNA, such as cell-free DNA, formalin-fixed samples or synthetic oligonucleotides. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2c8e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h8mt","text":"To use the protocol, a Bravo NGS workstation is required. Calibration of the instrument for this protocol has to be performed by the user and requires significant expertise in using the platform. Electronic protocol files for the Bravo NGS workstation are provided together with this protocol and a brief description of the steps performed by the liquid handling system, potentially providing a framework for setting the method up on liquid handling systems from other manufacturers. Some of the instructions, for example regarding the documentation and location of files, are specific to the environment and workflows of the Ancient DNA Core Unit of the MPI-EVA and have to be amended in other environments. We strongly advise against manual execution of the protocol, as manual handling lacks the precision of automated liquid handling and may lead to cross-contamination of samples or non-optimal results. For manual ssDNA 2.0 library preparation, please refer to Gansauge et al. 2020. Note that the adapter sequences added with this method differ from standard Illumina adapters by a 5-bp deletion in the P5-adapter, requiring a custom sequencing primer (see Gansauge et al. 2020). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1q6sr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9a8p7","text":"This protocol consists of two parts: (i) library preparation, with or without Uracil-DNA-glycosylase treatment for the removal of internal uracils from ancient DNA molecules, and (ii) library quantification by quantitative real-time PCR. A protocol for library amplification and indexing is provided separately. steps.section: Preparing and starting a library preparation run
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7k45m","text":"Fully resuspend stock suspension of MyOne C1 beads by vortexing. Make sure no bead pellet remains.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing and starting a library preparation run
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4h6kl","text":"Transfer 1,200 μl stock suspension of beads into an Eppendorf 1.5 ml Safe-lock tube. Pellet beads in magnetic rack, pipette off and discard supernatant. Add an additional 1200 µl stock suspension of beads (2400 µl used in total), pellet the beads and discard the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing and starting a library preparation run
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d0asa","text":"Wash beads twice with 1,000 µl 0.1xBWT buffer and discard the wash buffer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing and starting a library preparation run

steps.section: Preparing and starting a library preparation run
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5frrt","text":"Add remaining consumables (PCR plates, waste plate) to the MiniHub and missing tip boxes into the stackers. Double-check that all required positions are correctly filled. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: During the library preparation run
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"21aj9","text":"Observe parts of the run:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"epd9h","text":"Always check if all master mixes were correctly pipetted to the NUNC master mix plate. To do so, pause the system when it doesn't carry tips or plastic ware by clicking \"Pause\". Check the NUNC plate, place it back and click \"Continue\". ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5l1lp","text":"Check if all liquid was transferred from the FluidX tubes to the sample plate by watching this step (~75 min after the run started).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eiot2","text":"Approximately 30 min before the run ends, watch the elution step, especially the transfer of the eluate to the final library plate. Sometimes liquid may be left on the plate. This also becomes apparent by a lack of air in the tips, which is aspirated after the liquid. If the liquid transfer was incomplete, pause the robot once it finished the step and use a manual pipette to transfer remaining liquid to the library plate. Make sure to not aspirate beads. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Finishing the library preparation run
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"afavi","text":"After the elution step, the run is automatically paused. Take out the final library plate from position 7 of the Bravo deck, seal it with peelable foil in the Bio-Rad plate sealer (180 °C, 3 s, use sealing frame) and briefly centrifuge it in a plate centrifuge to make sure there are no air bubbles at the bottom of the wells. Perform another visual check to make sure that all bubbles are gone. If necessary centrifuge again. Peel off the foil and place the plate back into position 7 of the Bravo deck. Press \"continue\". ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Finishing the library preparation run
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5iggr","text":"When the run is finished take out the final library plate (49 µl per well) and the 50x dilution plate (50 µl per well) and seal them with peelable foil (180 °C, 3 s, use sealing frame). Store the library plate and the 50x dilution plate at -20 °C in freezer 'Morpheus'. The 50x dilution plate will be transferred to the post-PCR lab for qPCR measurement later on. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Finishing the library preparation run
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dcoin","text":"Discard all the plastic ware that is still in the robot. When doing so, check the plates for any remaining liquids to make sure that all pipetting steps were performed accurately. Collect liquid waste in 500 ml bottles next to the sink using a funnel. Discard used tips to regular trash and the tip boxes to the large waste bin on the left side of the cooling unit. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"drrha","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"etk10","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bb4g8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":15,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"66r2g","text":"[Documentation]","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fraae","text":"In case of unexpected remaining volumes in the disposed plastic ware, add comments in the 'notes' section of Labfolder as well as in the documentation of the experiment on Mattermost.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Finishing the library preparation run
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bm3be","text":"Clean the robot by wiping the Bravo deck and the benches using tissues and ethanol. Switch off the computer screen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing and starting a library preparation run
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9dpjk","text":"Vortex and spin down the sample rack. Open the FluidX screw-cap tubes in the sample rack with the decapper and discard the lids. Place the sample rack into the position in the MiniHub indicated by the form file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing and starting a library preparation run
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"akfuk","text":"When working with a pre-configured library plate, add FluidX tubes with LNCs and LPCs to the sample rack by replacing tubes at designated 'space holder' positions using the information from the \"samples_to_screen\" list available at \"P:\\AncientDNA\\samples\". Store the 'space holder' tubes for use in future experiments. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7lg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hvt3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ej108","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":15,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"fula","text":"[Documentation]","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e0ds5","text":"Cut the lines referring to the respective library plate in the \"samples-to-screen\" list and copy them to the \"libraries_done_list\" in the same folder.  ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9fdi8","text":"Save copies of the updated lists with date and initials and put the old versions in the  \n\"screening_list_backup\" folder.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1tvej","text":"Note down the batch information for the LNCs and LPCs in the respective fields in Labfolder.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Preparing and starting a library preparation run
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a5lit","text":"Before each run, follow the instructions in Labfolder and document the experiment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e248g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98dni","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"47glm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":15,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"dffcm","text":"[Documentation]","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9eg5r","text":"Document the experiment in Labfolder.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"580de","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"4duni","text":"[Note]","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c5ggg","text":"The Labfolder entry name consists of the name of the Labfolder template and the library plate ID. To document your experiment fill the provided data element fields in Labfolder. They serve as a template later for creating the CoreDB entry. Providing the plate ID and performing the database work is usually done by the main person responsible for library preparation in the Core Unit, not by the person performing the experiment.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Library and spike-in quantification using qPCR
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5a63s","text":"Load stacker 3 with four full Bravo tip boxes (without lids) as indicated in the form file. Make sure that all the other stackers stay empty.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Library and spike-in quantification using qPCR
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ahnl8","text":"Clean the robot by wiping the Bravo deck and the benches using tissues and ethanol. Switch off the robot and the cooling device and restart the computer so that remote access to the computer becomes possible. Switch off the computer screen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
